Home > external > kegg > getKEGGModelForOrganism.m

getKEGGModelForOrganism

PURPOSE

getKEGGModelForOrganism

SYNOPSIS

function model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioG,minScoreRatioKO,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

DESCRIPTION 

 getKEGGModelForOrganism
   Reconstructs a genome-scale metabolic model based on protein homology to the
   orthologies in KEGG

   organismID          three or four letter abbreviation of the organism (as
                       used in KEGG). If not available, use a closely related
                       species. This is used for determing the
                       phylogenetic distance. Use 'eukaryotes' or
                       'prokaryotes' to get a model for the whole domain.
                       Only applicable if fastaFile is empty, i.e. no
                       homology search should be performed
   fastaFile           a FASTA file that contains the protein sequences of
                       the organism for which to reconstruct a model (opt,
                       if no FASTA file is supplied then a model is
                       reconstructed based only on the organism
                       abbreviation. This option ignores all settings except for
                       keepUndefinedStoich, keepIncomplete and keepGeneral)
   dataDir             directory for which to retrieve the input data.
                       Should contain a combination of these sub-folders:
                       -dataDir\keggdb
                           The KEGG database files used in 1a (see below).
                       -dataDir\fasta
                           The multi-FASTA files generated in 1b (see below)
                       -dataDir\aligned
                           The aligned FASTA files as generated in 2a (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\hmms
                           The hidden Markov models as generated in 2b or
                           downloaded from BioMet Toolbox (see below)
                       The final directory in dataDir should be styled as
                       proXXX_keggYY or eukXXX_keggYY, indicating whether
                       the HMMs were trained on pro- or eukaryotic sequences,
                       using a sequence similarity threshold of XXX %,
                       fitting the KEGG version YY. E.g. euk100_kegg82.
                       (opt, see note about fastaFile. Note that in order to
                       rebuild the KEGG model from a database dump, as opposed to
                       using the version supplied with RAVEN, you would still need
                       to supply this)
   outDir              directory to save the results from the quering of
                       the hidden Markov models. The output is specific
                       for the input sequences and the settings used. It
                       is stored in this manner so that the function can
                       continue if interrupted or if it should run in
                       parallel. Be careful not to leave output files
                       from different organisms or runs with different
                       settings in the same folder. They will not be
                       overwritten (opt, default is a temporary dir where
                       all *.out files are deleted before and after doing
                       the reconstruction)
   keepUndefinedStoich include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
                       (opt, default true)
   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
                       such reactions (opt, default false)
   cutOff              significans score from HMMer needed to assign genes
                       to a KO (opt, default 10^-50)
   minScoreRatioG      a gene is only assigned to KOs for which the score
                       is >=log(score)/log(best score) for that gene.
                       This is to prevent that a gene which clearly belongs
                       to one KO is assigned also to KOs with much lower
                       scores (opt, default 0.8 (lower is less strict))
   minScoreRatioKO     ignore genes in a KO if their score is
                       <log(score)/log(best score in KO). This is to
                       "prune" KOs which have many genes and where some
                       are clearly a better fit
                       (opt, default 0.3 (lower is less strict))
   maxPhylDist         -1: only use sequences from the same domain
                       (Prokaryota, Eukaryota)
                       other (positive) value: only use sequences for
                       organisms where the phylogenetic distance is at
                       the most this large (as calculated in getPhylDist)
                       (opt, default Inf, which means that all sequences will
                       be used)
   nSequences          for each KO, use up to this many sequences from
                       the most closely related species. This is mainly to
                       speed up the alignment process for KOs with very
                       many genes. This subsampling is performed before
                       running CD-HIT (opt, default inf)
   seqIdentity         sequence identity threshold in CD-HIT, referred as
                       "global sequence identity" in CD-HIT User's Guide.
                       The only possible options are 1 (100 %), 0.9 (90 %)
                       and 0.5 (50 %). If other values are provided, CD-HIT
                       is skipped (opt, default -1, i.e. CD-HIT is skipped)

   model               the reconstructed model

   PLEASE READ THIS: The input to this function can be confusing, because
   it is intended to be run in parallel on a cluster or in multiple sessions.
   It therefore saves a lot of intermediate results to storage. This also
   serves the purpose of not having to do redundant calculations. This,
   however, comes with the disadvantage of somewhat trickier handling.
   This is what this function does:

   1a. Loads files from a local KEGG FTP dump and constructs a general
       RAVEN model representing the metabolic network. KEGG FTP access
       requires a <a href="matlab: web('http://www.bioinformatics.jp/en/keggftp.html')">license</a>.
   1b. Generates FASTA files from the KEGG FTP dump (see 1a). One
       multi-FASTA file for each KO in KEGG is generated. Make sure you
       actually need these first, as the parsing is time-consuming (see below).

   These steps only have to be re-done every time KEGG updates their
   database (or rather when the updates are large enough to warrant
   rerunning this part). Many user would probably never use this feature.

   2a. Does alignment of the multi-FASTA files for future use. This uses the
       settings "useEvDist" and "nSequences" to control which sequences
       should be used for constructing Hidden Markov models (HMMs), and
       later for matching your sequences to.
   2b. Trains hidden Markov models using HMMer for each of the aligned
       FASTA files.

   The most common alternatives here would be to use sequences from only
   eukaryotes, only prokaryotes or all sequences in KEGG. As explained in
   the README.md file, various sets of pre-trained hidden Markov models are
   available at <a href="matlab: web('http://biomet-toolbox.org/index.php?page=downtools-raven')">BioMet Toolbox</a>.
   This is normally the most convenient way, but if you would like to use,
   for example, only fungal sequences for training the HMMs then you need
   to run this part.

   3a. Queries the HMMs with sequences for the organism you are making a
       model for. This step uses both the output from step 1a and from 2b.
   3b. Constructs a model based on the fit to the HMMs and the chosen
       parameters.

   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are reconstructing
   the model.

   In principle the function looks at which output that is already available
   and runs only the parts that are required for step 3. This means
   that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   -1b is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   OR multi-FASTA files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this
   step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead
   (see above). If not all files exist it will try to find
   the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2a is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped
   if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2b is only performed if not all required HMMs exist in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA files or
   HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,...
    keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioG,...
    minScoreRatioKO,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

   Eduard Kerkhoven, 2017-07-24

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG
  • getPhylDist getPhylDist
This function is called by:

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function files=listFiles(directory)

0167 if nargin<2
0168     fastaFile=[];
0169 end
0170 if nargin<3
0171     dataDir=[];
0172 end
0173 if nargin<4
0174     outDir=[];
0175 end
0176 if isempty(outDir)
0177     outDir=tempdir;
0178     %Delete all *.out files if any exist
0179     delete(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0180 end
0181 if nargin<5
0182     keepUndefinedStoich=true;
0183 end
0184 if nargin<6
0185     keepIncomplete=true;
0186 end
0187 if nargin<7
0188     keepGeneral=false;
0189 end
0190 if nargin<8
0191     cutOff=10^-50;
0192 end
0193 if nargin<9
0194     minScoreRatioG=0.8;
0195 end
0196 if nargin<10
0197     minScoreRatioKO=0.3;
0198 end
0199 if nargin<11
0200     maxPhylDist=inf; %Include all sequences for each reaction
0201 end
0202 if nargin<12
0203     nSequences=inf; %Include all sequences for each reaction
0204 end
0205 if nargin<13
0206     seqIdentity=-1; %CD-HIT is not used in the pipeline
0207 end
0208 
0209 % Checking if dataDir is consistent. It must point to pre-trained HMMs set,
0210 % compatible with the the current RAVEN version.
0211 % The user may have the required zip file already in working directory or
0212 % have it extracted. If the zip file and directory is not here, it is
0213 % downloaded from BioMet ToolBox 2.0 server.
0214 
0215 if ~isempty(dataDir)
0216     hmmOptions={'euk100_kegg82'; ...
0217         'euk90_kegg82'; ...
0218         'euk50_kegg82'; ...
0219         'prok100_kegg82'; ...
0220         'prok90_kegg82'; ...
0221         'prok50_kegg82'};
0222     if isempty(regexp(dataDir,strcat(hmmOptions,'$'))) % Check if dataDir ends with any of the hmmOptions
0223         EM='Pre-trained HMMs set is not recognised. It should match any of the following sets (which are available to download):';
0224         disp(EM);
0225         disp(hmmOptions);
0226         return;
0227     end;
0228     if exist(dataDir,'dir')
0229         fprintf('Provided dataDir is in correct format for this RAVEN version in order to use pre-trained HMMs...\n')
0230     elseif ~exist(dataDir,'dir') && exist([dataDir,'.zip'],'file')
0231         fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0232         unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0233     else
0234         fprintf('Downloading HMMs archive file...\n');
0235         websave([dataDir,'.zip'],['http://biomet-toolbox.org/tools/downloadable/files/',dataDir,'.zip']);
0236         fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0237         unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0238     end;
0239 end;
0240 
0241 %Check if the fasta-file contains '/' or'\'. If not then it's probably just
0242 %a file name. It is then merged with the current folder
0243 if any(fastaFile)
0244     if ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'\')) && ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'/'))
0245         fastaFile=fullfile(pwd,fastaFile);
0246     end
0247     %Create the required sub-folders in dataDir if they dont exist
0248     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),'dir')
0249         mkdir(dataDir,'keggdb');
0250     end
0251     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir')
0252         mkdir(dataDir,'fasta');
0253     end
0254     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir')
0255         mkdir(dataDir,'aligned');
0256     end
0257     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0258         mkdir(dataDir,'hmms');
0259     end
0260     if ~exist(outDir,'dir')
0261         mkdir(outDir);
0262     end
0263 end
0264 
0265 %First generate the full KEGG model. The dataDir mustn't be supplied as
0266 %there is also an internal RAVEN version available
0267 if any(dataDir)
0268     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0269 else
0270     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG([],keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0271 end
0272 fprintf('Completed generation of KEGG model\n');
0273 model.id=organismID;
0274 model.c=zeros(numel(model.rxns),1);
0275 
0276 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then just remove all genes which are not for
0277 %the given organism ID
0278 if isempty(fastaFile)
0279     if ismember(organismID,{'eukaryotes','prokaryotes'})
0280         phylDists=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0281         if strcmp(organismID,'eukaryotes')
0282             proxyid='hsa'; %Use H. sapiens here
0283         else
0284             proxyid='eco'; %Use E. coli here
0285         end
0286         [~,phylDistId]=ismember(proxyid,phylDists.ids);
0287         idsToKeep=phylDists.ids(~isinf(phylDists.distMat(phylDistId,:)));
0288         taxIDs=cellfun(@(x) x{1},cellfun(@(x) strsplit(x,':'),model.genes,'UniformOutput',false),'UniformOutput',false);
0289         I=ismember(upper(taxIDs),upper(idsToKeep));
0290     else
0291         % KEGG organism IDs may have three or four letters
0292         organismID=strcat(organismID,':');   %Add colon for accurate matching
0293         if length(organismID)==4
0294             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:4),organismID),model.genes);
0295         else if length(organismID)==5
0296             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:5),organismID),model.genes);
0297             end
0298         end
0299     end
0300 
0301     %Remove those genes
0302     model.genes=model.genes(I);
0303     model.rxnGeneMat=model.rxnGeneMat(:,I);
0304 end
0305 
0306 %First remove all reactions without genes
0307 hasGenes=any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
0308 
0309 model=removeReactions(model,~hasGenes,true);
0310 
0311 %Clean gene names
0312 for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0313     %First get rid of the prefix organism id
0314     model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(strfind(model.genes{i},':')+1:end);
0315     
0316     %Find and remove the description in parentheses if any
0317     s=strfind(model.genes{i},'(');
0318     if any(s)
0319         model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(1:s-1);
0320     end
0321 end
0322 
0323 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then we're done here
0324 if isempty(fastaFile)
0325     %Create grRules
0326     model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0327     model.grRules(:)={''};
0328     
0329     %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0330     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0331         %Find the involved genes
0332         I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0333         model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0334         for j=2:numel(I)
0335             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0336         end
0337         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0338     end
0339     return;
0340 end
0341 
0342 %Trim the genes so that they only contain information that can be matched
0343 %to the KEGG file of protein sequences (remove all information after first
0344 %parenthesis)
0345 
0346 %NOTE: For some reason the organism abbreviation should be in lower case in
0347 %this database. Fix this here
0348 for i=1:numel(KOModel.genes)
0349     parIndex=strfind(KOModel.genes{i},'(');
0350     if any(parIndex)
0351        KOModel.genes{i}=KOModel.genes{i}(1:parIndex-1);
0352     end
0353     colIndex=strfind(KOModel.genes{i},':');
0354     KOModel.genes{i}=[lower(KOModel.genes{i}(1:colIndex-1)) KOModel.genes{i}(colIndex:end)];
0355 end
0356 
0357 %Create a phylogenetic distance structure
0358 phylDistStruct=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0359 [~, phylDistId]=ismember(model.id,phylDistStruct.ids);
0360 fprintf('Completed creation of phylogenetic distance matrix\n');
0361 
0362 %Calculate the real maximal distance now. An abitary large number of 1000 is
0363 %used for the "all in kingdom" or "all sequences" options. This is a bit
0364 %inconvenient way to do it, but it's to make it fit with some older code
0365 if isinf(maxPhylDist) || maxPhylDist==-1
0366     maxPhylDist=1000;
0367 end
0368 
0369 %Get the KO ids for which files have been generated. Maybe not the neatest
0370 %way..
0371 fastaFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta','*.fa'));
0372 alignedFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.fa'));
0373 alignedWorking=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.faw'));
0374 hmmFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','*.hmm'));
0375 outFiles=listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0376 
0377 %Check if multi-FASTA files should be generated. This should only be
0378 %performed if there are IDs in the KOModel structure that haven't been
0379 %parsed yet
0380 missingFASTA=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[fastaFiles;alignedFiles;hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0381 
0382 if ~isempty(missingFASTA)
0383     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file')
0384         EM=fprintf(['The file ''genes.pep'' cannot be located at ' strrep(dataDir,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n']);
0385         dispEM(EM);
0386     end
0387     %Only construct models for KOs which don't have files already
0388     fastaModel=removeReactions(KOModel,setdiff(KOModel.rxns,missingFASTA),true,true);
0389     %Permute the order of the KOs in the model so that constructMultiFasta
0390     %can be run on several processors at once
0391     fastaModel=permuteModel(fastaModel,randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(fastaModel.rxns)),'rxns');
0392     constructMultiFasta(fastaModel,fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'));
0393 end
0394 fprintf('Completed generation of multi-FASTA files\n');
0395 
0396 %Get the directory for RAVEN Toolbox. This is to get the path to the third
0397 %party software used
0398 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0399 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0400 
0401 if isunix
0402     if ismac
0403         binEnd='.mac';
0404     else
0405         binEnd='';
0406     end
0407 elseif ispc
0408     binEnd='';
0409 else
0410     EM='Unknown OS, exiting.';
0411     disp(EM);
0412     return
0413 end
0414 
0415 
0416 %Check if alignment of FASTA files should be performed
0417 missingAligned=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[alignedFiles;hmmFiles;alignedWorking;outFiles]);
0418 if ~isempty(missingAligned)
0419     missingAligned=missingAligned(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingAligned)));
0420     %Align all sequences using MAFFT
0421     for i=1:numel(missingAligned)
0422         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0423         %parallell process. The faw-files are saved as temporary files to
0424         %keppt track of which files are being worked on
0425         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0426             %Check that the multi-FASTA file exists. It should do so since
0427             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0428             %continue if not.
0429             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0430                 EM=['WARNING: The multi-FASTA file for ' missingAligned{i} ' does not exist'];
0431                 dispEM(EM,false);
0432                 continue;
0433             end
0434 
0435             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0436             %file and continue
0437             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0438             if s.bytes<=0
0439                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'w');
0440                 fclose(fid);
0441                 continue;
0442             end
0443 
0444             %Create an empty file to prevent other threads to start to work on the same alignment
0445             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'w');
0446             fclose(fid);
0447 
0448             %First load the FASTA file, then select up to nSequences sequences
0449             %of the most closely related species, apply any constraints from
0450             %maxPhylDist, and save it as a temporary file, and create the
0451             %model from that
0452 
0453             fastaStruct=fastaread(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0454             phylDist=inf(numel(fastaStruct),1);
0455             for j=1:numel(fastaStruct)
0456                %Get the organism abbreviation
0457                index=strfind(fastaStruct(j).Header,':');
0458                if any(index)
0459                     abbrev=fastaStruct(j).Header(1:index(1)-1);
0460                     [~, index]=ismember(abbrev,phylDistStruct.ids);
0461                     if any(index)
0462                         phylDist(j)=phylDistStruct.distMat(index(1),phylDistId);
0463                     end
0464                end
0465             end
0466 
0467             %Inf means that it should not be included
0468             phylDist(phylDist>maxPhylDist)=[];
0469 
0470             %Sort based on phylDist
0471             [~, order]=sort(phylDist);
0472 
0473             %Save the first nSequences hits to a temporary FASTA file
0474             if nSequences<=numel(fastaStruct)
0475                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order(1:nSequences));
0476             else
0477                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order);
0478             end
0479 
0480             %Do the alignment if there are more than one sequences,
0481             %otherwise just save the sequence (or an empty file)
0482             if numel(fastaStruct)>1
0483                 if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0484                     if ~ispc
0485                         if seqIdentity==1
0486                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0487                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0488                             tmpFile=tempname;
0489                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000 -T 8']);
0490                             if status~=0
0491                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0492                                 dispEM(EM);
0493                             end
0494                             %Remove the old tempfile
0495                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0496                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0497                             end
0498                         elseif seqIdentity==0.9
0499                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0500                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0501                             cdhitInp90=tempname;
0502                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0503                             if status~=0
0504                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0505                                 dispEM(EM);
0506                             end
0507                             %Remove the old tempfile
0508                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0509                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0510                             end
0511                             tmpFile=tempname;
0512                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.9 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0513                             if status~=0
0514                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0515                                 dispEM(EM);
0516                             end
0517                             %Remove the old tempfile
0518                             if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0519                                 delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0520                             end
0521                         elseif seqIdentity==0.5
0522                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0523                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0524                             cdhitInp90=tempname;
0525                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0526                             if status~=0
0527                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0528                                 dispEM(EM);
0529                             end
0530                             %Remove the old tempfile
0531                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0532                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0533                             end
0534                             cdhitInp50=tempname;
0535                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' cdhitInp50 '" -c 0.9 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0536                             if status~=0
0537                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0538                                 dispEM(EM);
0539                             end
0540                             %Remove the old tempfile
0541                             if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0542                                 delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0543                             end
0544                             tmpFile=tempname;
0545                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -i "' cdhitInp50 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.5 -s 0.8 -n 3 -M 2000']);
0546                             if status~=0
0547                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0548                                 dispEM(EM);
0549                             end
0550                             %Remove the old tempfile
0551                             if exist(cdhitInp50, 'file')
0552                                 delete([cdhitInp50 '*']);
0553                             end
0554                         end
0555                     else
0556                         % CD-HIT is not available in Windows so we just
0557                         % export multifasta file into temporary file;
0558                         tmpFile=tempname;
0559                         fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0560                     end
0561                 else
0562                     tmpFile=tempname;
0563                     fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0564                 end
0565                 %Do the alignment for this file
0566                 if ~ispc
0567                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305',['mafft' binEnd]) '" --auto "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0568                 else
0569                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305','mafft.bat') '" --auto "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0570                 end
0571                 if status~=0
0572                     EM=['Error when performing alignment of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0573                     dispEM(EM);
0574                 end
0575                 %Remove the old tempfile
0576                 if exist(tmpFile, 'file')
0577                    delete([tmpFile '*']);
0578                 end
0579             else
0580                 %If there is only one sequence then it's not possible to do a
0581                 %multiple alignment. Just print the sequence instead. An
0582                 %empty file was written previously so that doesn't have to
0583                 %be dealt with
0584                 if numel(fastaStruct)==1
0585                     fastawrite(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fastaStruct);
0586                 end
0587             end
0588             %Move the temporary file to the real one
0589             movefile(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'f');
0590         end
0591     end
0592 end
0593 
0594 if ~ispc
0595     if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0596         fprintf('Completed clustering and multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0597     else
0598         fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences. Protein clustering was not requested or incorrect seqIdentity value was used\n');
0599     end
0600 else
0601     if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0602         fprintf('Protein clustering was skipped, since CD-HIT is not compatible with Windows');
0603     end
0604     fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0605 end
0606 
0607 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0608 missingHMMs=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0609 if ~isempty(missingHMMs)
0610     missingHMMs=missingHMMs(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingHMMs)));
0611 
0612     %Train models for all missing KOs
0613     for i=1:numel(missingHMMs)
0614         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0615         %parallell process
0616         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'file')
0617             %Check that the aligned FASTA file exists. It could be that it
0618             %is still being worked on by some other instance of the
0619             %program (the .faw file should then exist). This should not
0620             %happen on a single computer. I don't throw an error, because
0621             %it should finalize the ones it can.
0622             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']),'file')
0623                 EM=['The aligned FASTA file for ' missingHMMs{i} ' does not exist'];
0624                 dispEM(EM,false);
0625                 continue;
0626             end
0627 
0628             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0629             %file and continue
0630             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']));
0631             if s.bytes<=0
0632                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'w');
0633                 fclose(fid);
0634                 continue;
0635             end
0636             %Create a temporary file to indicate that it is working on the
0637             %KO. This is because hmmbuild cannot overwrite existing files.
0638             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'w');
0639             fclose(fid);
0640 
0641             %Create HMM
0642             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmbuild' binEnd]) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']) '"']);
0643             if status~=0
0644                 EM=['Error when training HMM for ' missingHMMs{i} ':\n' output];
0645                 dispEM(EM);
0646             end
0647 
0648             %Delete the temporary file
0649             delete(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']));
0650         end
0651     end
0652 end
0653 fprintf('Completed generation of HMMs\n');
0654 
0655 %Check which new .out files that should be generated
0656 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0657 missingOUT=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,outFiles);
0658 if ~isempty(missingOUT)
0659     missingOUT=missingOUT(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingOUT)));
0660     for i=1:numel(missingOUT)
0661         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0662         %parallell process
0663         if ~exist(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'file')
0664             %Check that the HMM file exists. It should do so since
0665             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0666             %continue if not.
0667             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']),'file')
0668                 EM=['The HMM file for ' missingOUT{i} ' does not exist'];
0669                 dispEM(EM,false);
0670                 continue;
0671             end
0672 
0673             %Save an empty file to prevent several threads working on the
0674             %same file
0675             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0676             fclose(fid);
0677 
0678             %If the HMM file is empty then save an out file and continue
0679             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']));
0680             if s.bytes<=0
0681                 continue;
0682             end
0683 
0684             %Check each gene in the input file against this model
0685             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmsearch' binEnd]) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fastaFile '"']);
0686             if status~=0
0687                 EM=['Error when querying HMM for ' missingOUT{i} ':\n' output];
0688                 dispEM(EM);
0689             end
0690 
0691             %Save the output to a file
0692             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0693             fwrite(fid,output);
0694             fclose(fid);
0695         end
0696     end
0697 end
0698 fprintf('Completed matching to HMMs\n');
0699 
0700 %***Begin retrieving the output and putting together the resulting model
0701 
0702 %Retrieve matched genes from the HMMs
0703 koGeneMat=zeros(numel(KOModel.rxns),3000); %Make room for 3000 genes
0704 genes=cell(3000,1);
0705 %Store the best score for a gene in a hash list (since I will be searching
0706 %many times)
0707 hTable = java.util.Hashtable;
0708 
0709 geneCounter=0;
0710 for i=1:numel(KOModel.rxns)
0711     if exist(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']), 'file')
0712         fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']),'r');
0713         beginMatches=false;
0714         while 1
0715             %Get the next line
0716             tline = fgetl(fid);
0717 
0718             %Abort at end of file
0719             if ~ischar(tline)
0720                 break;
0721             end
0722 
0723             if and(beginMatches,strcmp(tline,'  ------ inclusion threshold ------'))
0724                 break;
0725             end
0726 
0727             if beginMatches==false
0728                 %This is how the listing of matches begins
0729                 if any(strfind(tline,'E-value '))
0730                     %Read one more line that is only padding
0731                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0732                     beginMatches=true;
0733                 end
0734             else
0735                 %If matches should be read
0736                 if ~strcmp(tline,'   [No hits detected that satisfy reporting thresholds]') && ~isempty(tline)
0737                     elements=regexp(tline,' ','split');
0738                     elements=elements(cellfun(@any,elements));
0739 
0740                     %Check if the match is below the treshhold
0741                     score=str2num(elements{1});
0742                     gene=elements{9};
0743                     if score<=cutOff
0744                         %If the score is exactly 0, change it to a very
0745                         %small value to avoid NaN
0746                         if score==0
0747                            score=10^-250;
0748                         end
0749                         %Check if the gene is added already and, is so, get
0750                         %the best score for it
0751                         I=hTable.get(gene);
0752                         if any(I)
0753                             koGeneMat(i,I)=score;
0754                         else
0755                             geneCounter=geneCounter+1;
0756                             %The gene was not present yet so add it
0757                             hTable.put(gene,geneCounter);
0758                             genes{geneCounter}=gene;
0759                             koGeneMat(i,geneCounter)=score;
0760                         end
0761                     end
0762                 else
0763                     break;
0764                 end
0765             end
0766         end
0767         fclose(fid);
0768     end
0769 end
0770 koGeneMat=koGeneMat(:,1:geneCounter);
0771 
0772 %Remove the genes for each KO that are below minScoreRatioKO.
0773 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,1)
0774     J=find(koGeneMat(i,:));
0775     if any(J)
0776         koGeneMat(i,J(log(koGeneMat(i,J))/log(min(koGeneMat(i,J)))<minScoreRatioKO))=0;
0777     end
0778 end
0779 
0780 %Remove the KOs for each gene that are below minScoreRatioG
0781 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,2)
0782     J=find(koGeneMat(:,i));
0783     if any(J)
0784         koGeneMat(J(log(koGeneMat(J,i))/log(min(koGeneMat(J,i)))<minScoreRatioG),i)=0;
0785     end
0786 end
0787 
0788 %Create the new model
0789 model.genes=genes(1:geneCounter);
0790 model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0791 model.grRules(:)={''};
0792 model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(numel(model.rxns),numel(model.genes));
0793 
0794 %Loop through the reactions and add the corresponding genes
0795 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0796     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0797         %Get all KOs
0798         I=find(strcmpi(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,'kegg.orthology'));
0799         KOs=model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I);
0800         %Find the KOs and the corresponding genes
0801         J=ismember(KOModel.rxns,KOs);
0802         [~, K]=find(koGeneMat(J,:));
0803 
0804         if any(K)
0805             model.rxnGeneMat(i,K)=1;
0806             %Also delete KOs for which no genes were found. If no genes at all
0807             %were matched to the reaction it will be deleted later
0808             L=sum(koGeneMat(J,:),2)==0;
0809             model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I(L))=[];
0810             model.rxnMiriams{i}.name(I(L))=[];
0811         end
0812     end
0813 end
0814 
0815 %Find and delete all reactions without any genes. This also removes genes
0816 %that are not used (which could happen because minScoreRatioG and
0817 %minScoreRatioKO)
0818 I=sum(model.rxnGeneMat,2)==0;
0819 model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
0820 
0821 %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0822 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0823     %Find the involved genes
0824     I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0825     model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0826     for j=2:numel(I)
0827         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0828     end
0829     model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0830 end
0831 end
0832 
0833 
0834 %Supporter function to list the files in a directory and return them as a
0835 %cell array
0836 function files=listFiles(directory)
0837     temp=dir(directory);
0838     files=cell(numel(temp),1);
0839     for i=1:numel(temp)
0840         files{i}=temp(i,1).name;
0841     end
0842     files=strrep(files,'.fa','');
0843     files=strrep(files,'.hmm','');
0844     files=strrep(files,'.out','');
0845     files=strrep(files,'.faw','');
0846 end
